column2: HAWAII DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Hawaii
column6: HI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column6: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column8: No right turn.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 2. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column6: before the traffic light turns red.
column8: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 3. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Call the police.
column6: Do not move.
column8: Do not panic.

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column8: the road ahead is narrow.

column2: 5. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column4: flash your headlights.
column6: sound your horn.
column8: use your emergency lights.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a narrow bridge ahead.
column6: a low place in the road.
column8: a winding road.

column2: 7. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Yield right-of-way to bicycles
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Stop
column6: Yield
column8: No U-Turn

column2: 10. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 11. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column6: You may not turn right
column8: You must increase your speed
column10: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 12. When you are driving, turning your head and looking before changing lanes is:
column4: a good driving habit.
column6: a bad driving habit.
column8: unnecessary, you should use your rearview mirror instead.

column2: 13. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 14. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, always.
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 15. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column6: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
column8: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.

column2: 16. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: slow down.
column8: respect the posted speed limit.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 18. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 19. When making a turn or lane change you should:
column4: signal your intentions for at least 100 feet before making the turn or lane change.
column6: signal your intentions for at least 50 feet before making the turn or lane change.
column8: signal only while making the turn or lane change.

column2: 20. A police officer stops you and asks you to take a test to determine the amount of alcohol in your blood. You:
column4: don’t have to take the test unless you have not violated any traffic rule.
column6: must prove you weren’t drinking.
column8: must take the test or risk losing your driver’s license.
column10: have the right to refuse taking the test.

column2: 21. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.
column6: speed up.
column8: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
column10: pull off the road to allow safe passing.

column2: 22. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: Never.
column6: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
column8: only when other vehicles yield.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: No Passing Zone
column6: Railroad crossing
column8: One-way street

column2: 24. This road sign is:
column4: a speed reduction sign.
column6: a guide sign.
column8: a regulatory sign.

column2: 25. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: 30 minutes.
column6: 3 hours.
column8: 10 minutes.

column2: 26. To drive safely, you should:
column4: drive within your physical limitations.
column6: know the effect of any medicine on your driving ability.
column8: keep physically fit and have regular physical examinations.

column2: 27. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: for yeild signs.
column8: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 28. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column8: Replacing worn wiper blades.

column2: 29. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there's an intersection ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 30. To enter a freeway:
column4: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column6: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column8: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column10: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
